analysis.Summary: Walkthrough.vue is a full-screen onboarding slider that presents a series of introductory slides, culminating in a final call-to-action slide offering Sign Up, Sign In, or Continue as Guest. It uses Embla Carousel for slide mechanics and Capacitor Preferences to record that the user has completed the walkthrough.
analysis.Purpose: To guide new users through key app features on first launch and then route them to Sign Up / Sign In or let them continue as guests, while persisting a flag so the walkthrough does not reappear.

Components.name: Walkthrough
responsibilities: Render a full-screen carousel of slides with titles, subtitles, and images
Show navigation dots and a skip button
Handle slide tweening (opacity and scale) and background translation
Provide Sign Up, Sign In, and guest entry flows
Emit an event to update the first-use flag

Components.name: emblaCarouselVue
Components.responsibilities: Provides emblaNode ref and emblaApi to control the carousel (init, scroll, select, reInit)

Functions.name: setFirstUseFalse
Functions.description: Marks onboarding as completed in Capacitor Preferences and emits 'updateFirstUse' event with false.

Functions.name: openFirstRoute
Functions.description: Navigates to the given named route (e.g. 'Sign Up' or 'Sign In'), persists first-use flag as false, and emits update event.

parameters.name: routeName
parameters.description: Name of the route to navigate to

Functions.name: scrollTo
Functions.description: Programmatically scrolls the carousel to the given slide index.

Functions.name: onInit
Functions.description: Initializes scrollSnaps array from emblaApi on carousel initialization.

Functions.name: onSelect
Functions.description: Updates selectedIndex whenever the carousel selection changes.

Functions.name: onScroll
Functions.description: Calculates tween values for slide opacity, scale, and background translation on scroll events.

analysis.Usage: Imported as a view or component in a parent, e.g. <Walkthrough @updateFirstUse="handleFirstUse"/>, typically mounted on first app launch or when route name is 'Walkthrough'.
Notes: The component uses script setup syntax and Composition API.
Background components (WavesBackground, ColorsBackground) are commented out and can be re-enabled for visual effects.
Image assets are dynamically required by index; ensure correct asset naming convention.
The TWEEN_FACTOR constant controls the intensity of opacity/scale animations.
Skip button uses @click.native modifier to directly trigger setFirstUseFalse on the root div.
